34 class VMCX : public CentralComplex{
35 private:
36  //
37  // The core is brought in from CentralComplex, we just need the
38  // singular vector memory components.
39  //
40 
41  // Weight matrix
42  Eigen::Matrix<double, CX_N_CPU4, 1> W_VM;
43 
44  // Vector memory neuron, basically acts as an on/off
45  // switch. Should be 1 (max rate) when using vector memory,
46  // 0 when not.
47  double VM = 0;
48  double baseline = 0.5;
49 
50 public:
51  VMCX(){
52  this->W_VM.setConstant(0.5);
53  }
54

57 
59  void clear_vm();

74  Get the current status of the vm system (on or off)

76  */
77  bool vm_status();

110 //
111 // Public
112 //
113 // Question: Should I be using this->MEM here or this->CPU4?
114 // I think CPU4 is correct here but this may be an issue
115 void VMCX::store_vm(){
116  //this->W_VM = -1 * this->CPU4;
117  this->clear_vm(); //reset to 0.5
118  //this->W_VM = -1 * this->CPU4; //-(rCPU4) : Le Moel et al.
119  //this->W_VM = -1 * this->MEM; //-(Icpu4 - 0.5)
120  //this->W_VM = -1 * (this->CPU4 - this->W_VM); //-(rCPU4 - 0.5)
121  this->W_VM = -1 * (this->MEM - this->W_VM); //-(Icpu4 - 0.5)
122  ROS_INFO("VM STORED");
123 }
124 
125 void VMCX::clear_vm(){
126  this->W_VM.setConstant(0.5);
127 }
128 
129 // Turn on, no value check
130 void VMCX::activate_vm(){
131  this->VM = 1;
132  ROS_INFO("VM ACTIVATED");
133 }
134 
135 // Turn off, no value check
136 void VMCX::deactivate_vm(){
137  this->VM = 0;
138  ROS_INFO("VM DEACTIVATED");
139 }
140 
141 // Invert signal
142 bool VMCX::toggle_vm(){
143  this->VM = -1 * (VM - 1);
144  std::string state = this->vm_status() ? "ACTIVATED" : "DEACTIVATED";
145  ROS_INFO("VM %s", state.c_str());
146  return this->vm_status();
147 }
148 
149 // Return boolean conversion of VM activity
150 bool VMCX::vm_status(){ return this->VM == 1 ? true : false; };
151 
152 /* VMCX operation
153  Usage:
154  - To update the CX without using it for steering, ignore the output
155  - To use the CX for homing call VMCX::deactivate_vm() and then use the
156  function return value to steer.
157  - To use the VM component call VMCX::actiate_vm() and then use the
158  return value to steer. Note you need to store a VM first.
159  */
160 double VMCX::unimodal_VMCX(double theta, double speed){
161  double CXMotor = 0;
162 
163  this->tl2_output(theta, this->TL2);
164  this->cl1_output(this->TL2, this->CL1);
165  this->tb1_output(this->CL1, this->TB1);
166  this->cpu4_update(speed, this->TB1, this->MEM);
167 
168  this->CPU4 = this->MEM; // Copy unsigmoided CPU4 state
169  this->cpu4_output(this->CPU4); // Squash
170 
171  this->cpu1_output(this->TB1, this->CPU4, this->CPU1);
172 
173  CXMotor = this->motor_output(this->CPU1);
174 
175  return CXMotor;
176 }
177 
178 //
179 // Overrides
180 //
181 void VMCX::cpu1_output(Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> tb1,
182  Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> cpu4,
183  Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> cpu1){
184  cpu1 =
185  this->W_CPU4_CPU1 * (cpu4 + (this->W_VM * this->VM))
186  - (this->W_TB1_CPU1 * tb1);
187  // Include the VM component
188 
189  this->sigmoid(cpu1, this->cpu1_slope, this->cpu1_bias, this->noise);
190 }
191 
192 // Will need to override CPU1 update rule but wait out to get the rest
193 // working first
194 
195 
196 //
197 // Format and output VMCX internal status for the
198 //
199 void VMCX::get_status(std::vector<std::vector<double>> &activity){
200  std::vector<double> tl2_vec(this->TL2.data(),
201  this->TL2.data() +
202  this->TL2.rows() * this->TL2.cols()
203  );
204  std::vector<double> cl1_vec(this->CL1.data(),
205  this->CL1.data() +
206  this->CL1.rows() * this->CL1.cols()
207  );
208  std::vector<double> tb1_vec(this->TB1.data(),
209  this->TB1.data() +
210  this->TB1.rows() * this->TB1.cols()
211  );
212  std::vector<double> cpu4_vec(this->CPU4.data(),
213  this->CPU4.data() +
214  this->CPU4.rows() * this->CPU4.cols()
215  );
216  std::vector<double> mem_vec(this->MEM.data(),
217  this->MEM.data() +
218  this->MEM.rows() * this->MEM.cols()
219  );
220  std::vector<double> cpu1_vec(this->CPU1.data(),
221  this->CPU1.data() +
222  this->CPU1.rows() * this->CPU1.cols()
223  );
224  std::vector<double> vm_vec(this->W_VM.data(),
225  this->W_VM.data() +
226  this->W_VM.rows() * this->W_VM.cols()
227  );
228 
229  Eigen::Matrix<double, 1, 16> active_mat =
230  this->W_CPU4_CPU1 * (this->CPU4 +(this->VM * this->W_VM));
231 
232  std::vector<double> active_vm(active_mat.data(),
233  active_mat.data() +
234  active_mat.rows() * active_mat.cols()
235  );
236 
237  for (int i = 0; i < active_vm.size(); i++){
238  ROS_INFO("%f\n", active_vm[i]);
239  }
240 
241  activity.push_back(tl2_vec);
242  activity.push_back(cl1_vec);
243  activity.push_back(tb1_vec);
244  activity.push_back(cpu4_vec);
245  activity.push_back(mem_vec);
246  activity.push_back(cpu1_vec);
247  activity.push_back(vm_vec);
248  activity.push_back(active_vm);
249 }
